intro: Solenanthus olgae var. tschimganicus, commonly known as the Tschimganicus solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and some toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy aroma. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
